class CameraConfig

Detailed Description

Class for adding Video capturing functionality to Camera.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* VideoCamera::Cb_FrameCaptured)(INT ret, void *context, UINT8 HUGE *buf, UINT32 size, UINT32 stamp)
 

Callback function Cb_FrameCaptured is called when a frame is completely stored in the buffer.

Parameters:
ret ReturnCode of the driver layer
context The context to which this callback belongs.
buf currently used buffer to help keeping track of buffers in use
size size of data stored in buffer
frame_count number of current frame

typedef void(* VideoCamera::Cb_NotifyCaptureBufferStatus)(void *context, UINT8 free_buffer_count)
 

Callback function Cb_NotifyCaptureBufferStatus is called when the buffer status is checked.

Parameters:
context The context to which this callback belongs.
free_buffer_count The number of free buffers.

typedef void(* VideoCamera::Cb_VideoCapturePaused)(INT ret, void *context)
 

Callback function Cb_VideoCapturePaused is called when video capture has been paused.

Parameters:
ret ReturnCode of the driver layer
context The context to which this callback belongs.

typedef void(* VideoCamera::Cb_VideoCaptureStopped)(INT ret, void *context)
 

Callback function Cb_VideoCaptureStopped is called when video capture has been stopped.

Parameters:
ret ReturnCode of the driver layer
context The context to which this callback belongs.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::AllocateCaptureBuffers (  UINT8 &  buf_count,
UINT32  buf_len = 0
) 
 

Allocates buffers for encoded video frames with given buffer count.

Parameters:
buf_count IN: Number of buffers to be allocated, OUT: Number of allocated buffers. NOTE: There will be no check if number of allocated buffers are identical to requested ones. So this out parameter can be ignored.
buf_len Requested size of buffers. Parameter will be usually ignored. Therefore it can be omitted.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if allocation was successful, FALSE if not. Check last error for a detailed error code.

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::Close (   )  [virtual]
 

Close() frees any allocated buffers for capturing and unlocks the camera.

Returns:
returns FALSE if unlocking or buffer deallocation fails.

Reimplemented from Camera.

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::FreeCaptureBuffers (   ) 
 

Frees allocated resources such as allocated buffers in case of buffer allocation done by device layer

Returns:
returns TRUE if releasing capture buffers was successful.

UINT8 &  count

Returns an array of available frame rates which are supported by the video camera.

Parameters:

UINT8 &  count

Get an array of supported sizes for images.

Parameters:

Returns:
TRUE when image size list was created, otherwise FALSE.

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::Open (   )  [virtual]
 

Open() sets default values for the VideoCamera which are available through a CameraConfig or by driver. Furthermore it trys to Lock the Camera for exclusive usage.

Returns:
returns FALSE, if setting values or locking failed.

Reimplemented from Camera.

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::PauseVideoCapture (  Cb_VideoCapturePaused  cb_video_capture_paused = 0,
void *  context = 0
) 
 

Pauses video capturing. Applicable only when video capturing is started.

Parameters:
cb_video_capture_paused Application callback for video capture paused.
context Context pointer of caller application.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if pausing was successfully, otherwise FALSE.

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::ReleaseCaptureBuffer (  UINT8 HUGE *  buf  ) 
 

ReleaseCaptureBuffer marks the given buffer as being unused.

Parameters:
buf The pointer to the buffer to release.
Returns:
TRUE, if release was successful. Otherwise FALSE.

virtual BOOLEAN VideoCamera::SetCaptureImageSize (  ImageSizeType  capture_image_size,
TransformationType  capture_transformation = Camera::NoTransformation
)  [virtual]
 

Sets the capture image size for snapshots and video capturing.

Parameters:
capture_image_size predefined image size for captured image.
capture_transformation capture image transformation.
Returns:
returns TRUE if given size is possible.

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::SetFrameRate (  FrameRateType  frame_rate  ) 
 

Sets the frame rate for capturing video. This method can be used in before viewfinder is started, during viewfinding and during capturing. The call is optional. Default framerate is 15 fps. This method does not check if twilight mode is enabled. It applies for twilight mode off.

Parameters:
frame_rate Frame rate which will be used for capturing.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if framerate is supported and could be set. Otherwise FALSE. When it returns FALSE check camera error for a detailed reason. The reason can be CameraNotReadyError when GDD does not accept the set framerate or UnsupportedFrameRateError when framerate is not in the list of supported framerates (see GetSupportedFrameRates).

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::SetViewfinderRect (  Rect &  vf_rect,
INT  display_idx = 0,
TransformationType  view_transformation = NoTransformation,
ScalingMethodType  view_scaling_method = NoScaling
)  [virtual]
 

Sets the rectangle, display, orientation and scaling of the camera viewfinder.

Parameters:
vf_rect Rectangle which describes the viewfinder (in and out parameter)
diplay_idx Index of display where viewfinder should be drawn at, default is main display
view_transformation Desired orientation of the viewfinder, default is normal orientation.
view_scaling_method Desirted scaling method, default is no scaling.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if viewfinder size, position and orientation is valid.

virtual BOOLEAN VideoCamera::SetZoom (  ActionType  action,
UINT8  step_size = 1
)  [virtual]
 

Sets the zoom factor for the viewfinder

Parameters:
action defines which zooming action should be performed. Decrease - decreases zoom level Increase - increases zoom level Reset - resets zoom level to default value
step_size Step changes the interval on the performed action
Returns:
returns TRUE if zooming was successful

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::StartVideoCapture (  void *  context,
Cb_FrameCaptured  cb_frame_captured,
Cb_NotifyCaptureBufferStatus  cb_notify_captbuf_status,
UINT32  starting_time = 0
) 
 

Starts the video capturing after setting Video Properties, Viewfinder rect and ImageFormat.

Parameters:
context Context pointer of caller application.
cb_frame_captured Application callback for captured frame
cb_notify_captbuf_status Application callback for notifying the current status of free buffer count
Returns:
returns TRUE if capturing started successfully, FALSE if not

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::StartViewfinder (   )  [virtual]
 

StartViewfinder() enables the viewfinder on the display and sets the camera into active mode.

Returns:
returns FALSE if viewfinder can not be started due to missing preconditions or a hardware failure.

Reimplemented from Camera.

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::StopVideoCapture (  Cb_VideoCaptureStopped  cb_video_capture_stopped = 0,
void *  context = 0
) 
 

Stops video capturing.

Parameters:
cb_video_capture_stopped Application callback for video capture stopped.
context Context pointer of caller application.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if stopping was successfully, FALSE if not. Check last error code when FALSE is returned!

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::StopViewfinder (   )  [virtual]
 

StopViewFinder() stops the viewfinder and shuts down the camera.

Returns:
returns FALSE if an hardware error occurred.

Reimplemented from Camera.

BOOLEAN VideoCamera::UnPauseVideoCapture (  UINT32  new_video_capture_clock_time  ) 
 

Unpauses video capturing. Applicable only when video capturing is paused.

Parameters:
new_video_capture_clock_time E.g. time stamp of last catured/encoded frame.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if unpausing was successfully, otherwise FALSE.
